data.title: Static Launcher (File Association)
data.body:
I have a strong habit of opening files from Windows Explorer. My prefered method is to double-click the file. Herein lies the issue: Atom is not only hidden in %appdata% where it can be difficult to find, but there is no static file to associate to since atom.exe is in a versioned directory.

My suggestion is to create a very basic launcher that opens the latest version of Atom installed so that users can associate files to Atom without needing to update associations every update.

data.title: Search in Directory won't find line breaks (\n)
data.body:
Put a file that has line breaks in a directory, eg. 

``` xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<foo>
  <bar>hello world</bar>
</foo>
```

Right click the directory and select "Search in Directory". Turn regex on and enter \n in the search input, and perform the search. No results will be found.

If you search the file in the buffer (eg. âŒ˜-F) and search for \n with regex on, the line breaks will be found.

Fresh Install of OS X 10.10, running Atom 0.175.0. Files in question are definitely using Unix line endings.

data.title: Atom saving workspace issue.
data.body: i am just new to atom, i use sublime a lot, but because of it paid version i am coming to atom, but i want to see most functionality on sublime, like saving workspace for next time usage, correct me if i am wrong, if this feature is available. and please show me how to do it on my atom or if i have to install a package. Opps!!! i forgot my OS is Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. thanks

I have gotten Themes and some packages, like color-picker to install but most fail and it is this same error.

Is this more an NPM issue? I have looked at other issues but none seemed to throw this error.

data.title: :apple: try ~/Applications before using mdfind
data.body:
When Atom is installed with [Homebrew](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew), it will be in `~/Applications` instead of `/Applications`. This change updates the `atom.sh` startup script to check both `/Applications` and `~/Applications` before falling back to a metadata search.

Behavior is unchanged when `$ATOM_PATH` is unset or empty.

data.title: Pasting or typing instead of selected text results in random selection
data.body:
When I select some text and then paste something instead of it, sometimes I get random piece of the pasted text being selected. Look at the screencast:
![atom_paste_instead_selection](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7574192/5847084/71d1d11a-a1da-11e4-93f3-d76f59c67e5c.gif)
Here I'm selecting pieces of text and pasting some other text. In one of three times it results in a part of the pasted text being selected.

It leads to some inconvenience in my work. After I replace selected text with text from the clipboard, I should check whether something is selected before I type anything (because the text I'm typing will replace the selection).

The same when I start typing while some text is selected. The typed symbol replaces the selection, but sometimes it becomes selected itself. So when I type the second symbol, it replaces the first one.

The behaviour which I observe in other text editors is: replace selected text with pasted/typed one, deselect anything, place the cursor after the pasted text. This is the most convenient option, I guess.

My Atom version is 0.175.0 (and I've observed it in all previous versions), my system - OS X 10.9.5.

data.title: Atom hangs while trying to access networked paths
data.body:
As mentioned in the title, Atom hangs while switching to a tab wherein the opened file is no longer accessible (in my case, from a network drive which I had lost connection to).

Is this a known issue?
This is perhaps related to issue #1766.

data.title: Multiple tab regressions
data.body:
I just upgraded to 0.174.0 from 0.172.0 today using Webupd8's PPA.
The 'x' button in each tab seems to be missing, and it therefore makes closing tabs much more difficult (now you have to right-click the tab you want to close and click `Close Tab`).

Replicated on Ubuntu 14.10, Atom 0.174.0, safe mode.  I don't think a picture is needed, but if you want one, just tell me.

data.title: Clicking on Available Updates breadcrumb does not return to list of updates
data.body:
When viewing a package's details from the Available Updates view, the Available Updates breadcrumb does not go anywhere when it is clicked on.  This makes it impossible to go back and see what other packages were being updated.  A screenshot of the `<a>` tag not having an `href` property is below.

![screen shot 2015-01-21 at 3 04 41 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13830/5844130/80ad2f00-a17f-11e4-99b8-beefb242e9ac.png)

Tested on Atom v0.175.0 on OS X 10.10.1.

```
Installing build modules...

Installing apm...
```

when I run script/build (latest git, Fedora linux). I will build fine but why does the warning appear? I have node>0.8 and npm>1

data.title: Gracefully suggest user to install git
data.body:
I was trying out Atom on Windows, where I don't have git installed. I tried to install vim-mode, but the installation failed with the error code ENOGIT. In the installation log there was an error message much like that in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4030 

If the user actually reads the failure log, it'll become quite obvious that they need to install git / put it in their %PATH for the installation to succeed. However, I think it would be better (if possible) to notify the user about the need to install git with a dialog, for example. Another option would be to have a text "git is required to install this package" next to the package in the GUI.

Edit: of course the very simplest way would be to say somewhere on the download page, or in the installer, that installing git is required.

data.title: Preserve relative indentation of pasted lines when auto-indenting
data.body:
Previously with `autoIndentOnPaste` turned on, when a block of code was pasted, each line of the block was auto-indented based on the grammar.

Now, the relative indentation of the lines is preserved, and the indentation of the entire block of code is adjusted uniformly such that the first line's indentation matches the grammar's suggested indent level.

Fixes #4648.

data.title: [Idea] Tabs
data.body: Idea is to delete from DOM unfocused tab container as it made with main editor lines, so it's allow to boost atom performance a lot, less nodes = better speed.

data.title: Editor window is blank after switching tabs
data.body:
When using Atom for a while and editing a single file within a project and then switching tabs to a different file the editor window is blank until it is scrolled, then the content of the current tab is rendered correctly.

Atom Version 0.174.0 on OSX 10.10.1.

data.title: Can't open and view readonly files / Must have write access to be able to open file
data.body:
Platform: MacOS 10.10.
Atom: 0.174.0

Trying to open a readonly file shows an error: "Permission denied '<Path to file>'". It was possible to open readonly files before. The change was introduced some version ago. 

Steps to reproduce: 
1. In terminal, change access permission to read only with "chmod 444 <filename>"
2. Try to open file in atom

data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT, open '/Users/torbenkikkert/Downloads/startbootstrap-agency-1.0.1/main.less'
Files missing when you drag a git repo into atom
data.body: Lets assume you have a rails project and one of the files you said for git to ignore is `database.yml` in some cases when you drag a folder from finder (**osx 10.10.x**) to the latest version of atom (I am running **0.174.0** that file instead of being greyed out to show that its apart of git ignore will just not show up at all in the editor, but is in the finder window for that project. This doesn't always happen though, that same project might be dragged into a new instance of the editor and the file might appear.

data.title: Couldn't load plugin
data.body:
Hi, When I try to embed something in the view,it is bringing a grey screen with could nt load plugin

data.title: Upgrade core to space-pen 5.0
data.body:
Previously core was on space-pen 3.8 which meant it wasn't getting deduped across packages and so we were shipping 28 versions of it in the app.

This also upgrades Atom to jQuery 2.1.3 via https://github.com/atom/space-pen/pull/63
